COMMENT_TX: $Opening Day in Tokyo; earliest date for a game in major league history
$the first career homer for Moss; second player in history to hit his first outside USA/Canada following Joey Hamilton, who homered in Mexico in 1996
$Ramirez couldn't be bothered to run as he posed for what he thought was a homer. He just made it to second as Oakland did not cover the base
$Second game of two-game series played in Tokyo
Athletics pitcher Justin Duchscherer left the game due to an injured arm
Athletics second baseman Donnie Murphy left the game due to an injured hand/wrist

ej,bradm001,P,campa902,Call at 1B Rangers designated hitter Milton Bradley thought he beat the relay at 1B and argued with 1B umpire Angel Campos; Rangers manager Ron Washington came out to discuss the play briefly; Bradley continued to argue from the dugout and was ejected by Campos; Bradley came back on the field to yell at Campos while 1B coach Gary Pettis stepped between the two; crew chief Tim McClelland ran to 1B from the plate and Washington came back out to help

ej,riggj801,M,millb901,Call at 3B $Valbuena slid into third head first just ahead of the tag; it appeared his hand might have touched the base but came off when he was tagged; Mariners third base coach Sam Perlozzo immediately objected to the out call and had to be led away from 3B umpire Bill Miller; manager Jim Riggleman also objected to the call and was ejected by Miller
